definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
children's game played with illustrated cards/pogs/menko (Japan)

sentences.english: He has a painting by Qibaishi.
sentences.chinese: 他藏有齐白石的一幅画儿。

sentences.english: He was entranced by the painting.
sentences.chinese: 他看这幅画儿都看得入神了。

sentences.english: He has a painting by Goya.
sentences.chinese: 他藏有戈雅的一幅画儿。

sentences.english: Mr. Adams's pictures about the Galaxy were shown in a famous gallery.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯先生描绘银河系的画儿在一家著名的画廊展出。
小狐狸看着自己的画儿。

sentences.english: Little Yuge has been fond of reading from a young age; she began reading from books with colorful pictures.
sentences.chinese: 小宇歌从小酷爱读书，最早是从彩色画儿书开始的。

sentences.english: But Fox would have to work fast to finish the painting before Bear arrived.
sentences.chinese: 但小狐狸必须在熊熊到来之前赶紧把画儿完成。

sentences.english: It was going to be a present for Bear.
sentences.chinese: 这画儿是给熊熊的礼物。

sentences.english: B: There’s no technique and the paintings look like a child has painted them.
sentences.chinese: 他的画儿一点技巧都没有，看起来就像小孩子画的。

sentences.english: There, the paint in a picture was said to be "seen as" an object.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，画儿上的油彩被说成“被看作”对象。

sentences.english: Don't frame the picture with a glass.

definition: a person after one's heart (charming person)/capable person
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
lord/master/young gentleman/male prostitute/catamite/mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes/(old form of address for one's husband) husband
(old) your servant (humble self-reference by young female)
